oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Greenback
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Edwin Best
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Greenback (Tenn.);
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This building, originally built as a store called Thompson's Stand in 1876, became the first Greenback Post Office in 1883. In approximately 1891 the post office functions were moved to a new location in present-day Greenback. The area this building is in became known as Old Greenback. It is approximately one mile east of the (1979) Greenback Post Office on Morganton Rd.
